headline: Fruit Punch
description: This fruit punch is refreshing, delicious, non-alcoholic, and easy to make with pineapple juice, ginger ale, orange sherbet, and bottled fruit punch.

video.description: See how to make a refreshing, delicious fruit punch.
video.name: Fruit Punch

name: Fruit Punch
recipeIngredient: 1 (64 fluid ounce) bottle fruit punch, chilled
1 (64 fluid ounce) bottle unsweetened pineapple juice, chilled

recipeInstructions.text: Combine ginger ale, fruit punch, and pineapple juice together in a punch bowl; add scoops of sherbet into the punch. Wait for the sherbet to begin melting, approximately 10 minutes; stir gently and serve.

review.reviewBody: I used fruitopia instead of fruit punch and substituted a can of frozen orange concentrate instead of sherbet. Excellent!
Couldn’t find orange sherbet so used rainbow sherbet. It was for baby shower so great colors! The punch had lots of “Yums” and was all gone!
yah i sure will

This punch is so good! I made it for a university honor society function. I used Simply brand Fruit Punch, Canada Dry Ginger Ale with Lemonade, Langer's 100% Pineapple Juice, and Great Value Orange Sherbet. It was a big hit! I highly recommend it!
Based on other comments I replaced the pineapple juice with cut pineapple. My one-gallon jar didn’t have room for the sherbet, so I left it out. It was a crowd pleaser and disappeared quickly.
This punch was a hit! Everyone loved it!

The great thing about this recipe is you can make it in a variety of ways. I used the bottled pineapple/mango/guava combo, a bottle of Hawaiian Punch and instead of using Ginger Ale, I used a bottle of sparkling apple cider (found in the juice isle) as the bubbly. It was awesome! If you're entertaining adults, champagne works well too!
I make this every year for my quilting group Christmas party. It is so easy and delicious.
Made this for mothers day and every one enjoyed some put in there alcohol of choice

This was super sweet! I used V8 Splash Fruit Medley for the fruit punch thinking Hawaiian Punch would make it too sweet. The kids liked it, but there was leftovers. I've made the rainbow sherbert 7-Up punch before and we really like that. But this was just too sweet for us.

Great for the all-school parent-child reception after the grade school commencement ceremony. I served it in the same kind of glass beverage server, didn't bother with any fruit chunks (don't need little hands in the punch!) but it comes out a pretty color and super, super easy. The sherbert is a great way to keep it cold without watering it down while we were all in the ceremony.
I made this yesterday and it was very well received. Great punch recipe!!

Made this for a piano recital - it was really easy to take all the (pre-chilled) ingredients and pour them into the container on site. The only "trouble" was scooping the sherbet in, and that was really easy. It was all gone before we left.
I didn't think the gingerale/Hawaiian punch is enough of a kick for real punch. It was too sweet and the sherbet got lost.
Very yummy! The family loved it!
Made this for a family get together. It was a huge hit with young and old alike!

I brought this punch to Thanksgiving with 15 of us. The non alcoholic drinkers appreciated the extra option instead of wine or water. I also used some frozen fruit that we floated on top to keep it cold. Almost all of it was consumed and there were a lot of compliments. ALSO, I used v8 berry splash instead of fruit punch and it was delicious! I would make this again for a party.

Made this for a kid's birthday party. It was a big hit for young and old alike. I used an actual Fruit Punch (not Hawaiian Punch)which was darker in color so it wasn't red looking like the photo, but it was delicious. Not a drop was left at the end of the party.
This turned out so good that we had to refill the bowl a few times
If you dont like how this looks, I added pineapple chuncks, cherries and multi-color sherbet and it was lovely and tasty.
this recipe is sooooooooo good :)
I made this punch for a surprise Birthday party. Everyone loved it! I've been told I'm in charge of making this punch for our Christmas get together! What a great simple recipe.
Quick, easy and yummy! Made this for my son's birthday party and everyone loved it.
Great recipe. Wouldnt change a thing
We did not care for this one

Easy & yummy!! I bought cheap, copy ginger-ale and cheap punch soda for extra fizz, store brand pineapple juice, and rainbow sherbet because it was the only one in gallon size! Teens at the dance I was serving for loved it and so did I!
Did this for a Girl Scout meeting and everyone loved it, bonus - it's super easy to throw together. Just take it and mix it there.

I made this punch for Halloween 2012. Everybody loved it! I put the chilled pineapple juice with some Hawaian Punch Strawberry Lemonade in the blender, poured the mix in a bowl then added more of the Hawaian Punch and the scoops of the Orange Sherbet. At the end added the Ginger Ale. Exactly how the recipe shows. Since it was for Halloween, I added monster eyeballs. Got lychee, red cherries and raisins. Put the cherries inside of the lychee, and the raisins inside of the cherries. Everything looked and tasted great! The eyes didn't float though, will upload a picture as soon as I can. Enjoy!
Excellent Punch!!!!! Did it for church and everyone was asking for the recipe!
We loved this, found it was better without the sherbet though (without sherbet it would be a five)
This is a great fruit punch recipe. I served it to a group that included children and adults and everyone enjoyed it! Wouldn't change a thing...great as is! Thanks for a great recipe.

I have been making this for years. Everyone loves this. I've made changes here and there delpending on what I have at hand or what's on sale and found that you can add a can of frozen OJ to this. You can also leave out the pineapple juice if you use the OJ it just isn'a as sweet and If you don't have fruit punch tropical punch kool aid works just as well and for an adult party addind some wildberry schnapps or coconut rum is delicious. This also makes great smoothies if you have any fresh or frozen fruit
This went over really well at my Easter brunch. It was slightly tart but everyone loved it.
My mom made this for my daughters 1st bday party and it was awesome! Everyone loved it!

Excellent recipe, it was a hit. the only thing is that if the kids are not used to drink sodas, they won't like it. for my next party i will make half recipe with Ginger ale and the other without any soda, but the flavor is really good. Some of my friends wanted to try it with vodka ((^,^)) but that will be for a different party.
Yum.
Very Yummy. Was a big hit !! Used Raspberry sherbet, oh so yummy
Quick, easy and a big hit with everyone young or old. Used rainbow sherbet.
This was a pretty good punch. Everyone seemed to enjoy it. It's not my favorite punch recipe, but I would make it again.

There is something about punch that just makes special occasions seem more...well, special! Served this for a bridal shower last weekend along with sodas. Everyone kept coming back for the punch and the soda was pretty much overlooked. Very good flavor! My daughter wants me to mix up more just for us to have at home!
This was pretty good. I'm not a big punch fan but made it for a bridal shower seemed to go over well.
very good the kids loved it nice summer drink
This punch was the hit of the party. I used rainbow sherbet and it was delicious. I will definitely use it again.
I loved this! It is very sweet, but had a great flavor. I will definitely make this again.
Everyone loved this, and it didn't have an overwhelming sweet taste. Color was plesant, and sherbet was a nice touch.

I used rainbow sherbet and it got rave reviews. I tried to soften the sherbet by putting it in the fridge for like 18 hours before i served the punch this made it easier to serve but not quite as many ice cream chunks as i wanted so maybe less time...

I had this at a family function with my inlaws and you cannot believe how many times they request that I make this! I simply use equal parts of bottled fruit punch and ginger-ale, although I'll have to try the pineapple. I also make ice molds or cubs out of punch so it stays cold but doesn't get watered down. I usually use raspberry sherbet but any kind will work! Make sure the liquids are cold, cold, cold.
while this recipe tasted delicious, it didn't look appetizing in the punch bowl & only got worse as the night went on. I would advise buying the brightest red fruit punch you can find.

I was in a rush and quickly tried to find an easy punch recipe for a party that I was attending that same day. I used others suggestions and brought the ingredients to the party (The hostess confirmed that she had a punch bowl) and through it together rather quickly. I also went on the suggestion of using champagne. We threw in a whole bottle and it tasted magnificent. I wasn't looking to "wow" anyone but this punch did just that! So easy and so many compliments! There were only about 20 people and it went really quickly since everyone went back for 3rds and 4ths! I will be using this recipe again and again. Thanks!
I made this for my nieces baby shower and it was a big hit everyone loved it and 2-3 people even took the recipe! Thank you!
I made this for a ladies night at church and it was a hit!! Great flavor! Will definitly make it again.
Served this for a baby shower. Everyone loved it. Wouldn't change a thing about it. Perfect.

I threw a bridal shower for my daughter today. Everyone loved this punch. We had 52 guests and the punch bowl was filled a few times. I had the recipe displayed by the punch, and I was told by many of the guests how good it was. This recipe I'll use from now on for all my parties. It's a keeper.
Yum, everyone loved it!
Easy to put together when you're having a big gathering, and it tastes great!!! I had a couple people ask me for the recipe.

Delicious and so easy! I have made this many times and everyone really enjoys it. I use Hawaiian Punch, store brand ginger ale and Dole pineapple juice. Most recently I could not find plain orange sherbet and ended up using orange cream sherbet from Edy’s and it worked out well with that too. It was very pretty. For people who said it didn’t look too appetizing I think you may want to avoid rainbow sherbet to avoid a gray mix in the end and use a bright red fruit punch like Hawaiian Punch. Also as stated in the recipe make sure to stir in the sherbet and let it melt a little for good flavor.
This punch is always a hit at parties where it is served. The pictures shows the rainbow sherbet - which is totally fine to use - but the guests typically enjoy the orange sherbet much better.

Maybe for a child's party this recipe is ok. But, I made it for a work event, celebrating a work anniversary, and I was embarrassed that I served it. I think it would fair much better at a child's event.

I made this for my daughters graduation party last year and will be using for my son's graduation this year. It tasted so good and went quickly so keep plenty left to refill the punch bowl. Had at least 50 people ask for the recipe.
Had this for my daughter's birthday party and was great! Kids loved it.
Had this for my daughter's birthday party and was great! Kids loved it.

After reading the reviews, I decided to use this at a Garden Club meeting. It was so easy and everyone loved it. I got more comments than I would have imagined. The only change I made was to use Rainbow sherbet that someone else suggested. Great recipe.
Love this punch!! Made it as recipe states and also made by adding 1/2 gal of OJ. Can't get enough of it when I make it for a party - I think I actually look forward to that more than the food!

This was a HUGE hit at my daughter's first birthday party! My guests didn't even touch the soda in the coolers and they happily downed the entire punch recipe. I have the same punch bowl that is in the photo, and I found that it only fit half of the recipe at a time - be sure to either know your punch bowl's capacity or go half to begin with (you can always add more later). Good thing I eye balled it before combining! Wonderful recipe, wouldn't change a thing. Five stars!
This was a hit at our local library event! I used rainbow sherbet, and it had great flavor. Also made it with Cherry 7Up instead of ginger ale; gave it great carbonation but added additional flavor.
This tastes great but looks aweful! Everyone seemed to love the punch but it started to turn more and more brown looking. Maybe next time I will try food coloring to brighten it up a bit.
We served this at my grandmother's 80th birthday party. It was a hit with everyone. Really easy to make and quite delicious.
This was delicious. Very easy to make. I had a holiday boutique party and all my guests enjoyed it. Will definitely keep this one for all party occasions.

*PERFECT*
I made this last winter for the Grand Opening of my husband's new business and it was a hit with adults and children alike. 
I am making it again tonight for a party and recall how EASY it is to take the ingredients in their containers and make the punch there. Last year I had to make four bowls full and easily kept the ice cream and juices cold between refills in their containers on the back porch in the snow!

(LATER)
Making this yet again for a holiday party! Might as well print a bunch of copies of the recipe right now; I always get asked for it!!
This was wonderful. Iused mango sherbet and peach juice insead. Ihad to refill the punch bowl twice.
Great punch for all ages. I served this for a baby shower and everyone was drinking it, even though we had a variety of drinks.

the 2 batches I made were all gone by the end of the anniversary party i threw for my parents! the only changes i made were not using quite all the sherbert (only used about half) and i also put pinapple peices in as well to make it look extra pretty :) very very good everyone loved it!
This was a huge hit at my daughter's birthday party... yum yum! Followed the recipe exactly, turned out great!
Perfection! Best punch I've ever had. Thanks for the recipe. My aunt used to make this and I never thought to get the recipe - allrecipes.com saves the day again!

I made this fruit punch for Christmas and everyone loved the taste. I agree with one of the reviewers that the color is a bit dull, but other than that it was a hit. I will make this again and maybe just add food coloring and see if that helps with the color.

This punch is so easy and it rocks. My only complaint was the color was kind of blah, so I added some red food coloring, and that made all the difference. :) I used natural fruit punch, which isn't bright red, so that was probably the issue. The punch is really awesome, though.
This is SO easy and everyone loves it,I use a pineapple,lemonade, applejuice frozen concentrate with it sometimes and it's wonderful
Super easy and super perfect! Easy to transport to a party, just leave everything in it's packaging and prepare where ever you go! Thank you!
I used this for a birthday party and it was a huge hit! A wonderful punch.

We made this on a rainy Sunday afternoon, scaled for just the two of us. I didn't have any sherbet, so I ran to the convenience store and bought an orange Push-up, then plunked it in the drink. Very refreshing!
This was great! I even tried it later without the sherbert and it still tasted great. Everyone at our party liked it.
A good classic party punch recipe that kids will love. The adults added champaign when I served it Christmas Eve. It was good that way too.
Easy and yummy.
I used Fresh Pineapple Chunks instead of Pineapple juice... and left out the sherbet. It was soooo yummy! I also added fresh cut up strawberries too. Will definitely make again!
Easy and yummy! I ran out at the babyshower I gave my friend!

Thanks for this recipe. I needed something easy for a 50th wedding anniversary party and tried a few different recipes from this site. This was definitely the easiest and went over great, even with using only half the amount of sherbet it called for. I was expecting about 100 people and bought enough for five batches and used every drop!
Everyone loved this, it was a huge hit at the baby shower. Got many requests for a copy of the recipe.
We just had a bridal shower for my daughter. The punch was a "big" success. Everyone said that it was delicious. We had 21 guests and went through a double batch. Very easy and very delicious!

I use this recipe for my 6th grade son's advisory/homeroom. It's great to take in and if the class isn't quite ready for it, that's ok because the ice cream needs to be on the soft side. It's so easy to do too. Just add it all to one big punch bowl!
